title: BTS's 'Love Yourself: Tear' is a Triumph
summary: “Love Yourself: Tear” is a reminder to K-pop fans that vocals can be just as important as dance moves. BTS’s main vocalist, Kim Nam-joon, or RM, has always been the strong point of the group but on “Tear’, he shines even brighter. “Fake Love” and ‘Tear are the type of tracks that listeners might not pick up on their first few listens but will appreciate once they've fully digested the EP.

intro.compiledSource:
var c=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var n=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,h=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var r=(e,t,s)=>t in e?c(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:s}):e[t]=s,i=(e,t)=>{for(var s in t||(t={}))n.call(t,s)&&r(e,s,t[s]);if(a)for(var s of a(t))h.call(t,s)&&r(e,s,t[s]);return e},l=(e,t)=>d(e,m(t));var u=(e,t)=>{var s={};for(var o in e)n.call(e,o)&&t.indexOf(o)<0&&(s[o]=e[o]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var o of a(e))t.indexOf(o)<0&&h.call(e,o)&&(s[o]=e[o]);return s};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(s){var o=s,{components:e}=o,t=u(o,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(i(i({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`In a world where every band is a boy band, BTS stands out. The Korean sextet has made a name for itself as not just another boy band but one that plays its own instruments and has choreographed dance routines that are so intricate they sometimes require special stage lighting.
Armed with these weapons, BTS has twice cracked the top 10 on the Billboard 200 album chart with its Love Yourself series. And the latest installment of this series \u2014 which doubles as its sixth EP \u2014 is no exception.
Furthermore, it\u2019s the strongest of the bunch.
It\u2019s impossible to talk about BTS without mentioning their massive following beyond Korea: Vivid, obsessive ARMYs (as they call them) who follow their every move and buy everything associated with them. This is why many people assume they are only famous because of social media and pandering ads (which is true). However, anyone who listens to their music will tell you that they deserve all this success. \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D proves it once again.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

var u=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var p=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var s=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(e,t,a)=>t in e?u(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:a}):e[t]=a,n=(e,t)=>{for(var a in t||(t={}))r.call(t,a)&&h(e,a,t[a]);if(s)for(var a of s(t))i.call(t,a)&&h(e,a,t[a]);return e},l=(e,t)=>c(e,p(t));var d=(e,t)=>{var a={};for(var o in e)r.call(e,o)&&t.indexOf(o)<0&&(a[o]=e[o]);if(e!=null&&s)for(var o of s(e))t.indexOf(o)<0&&i.call(e,o)&&(a[o]=e[o]);return a};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(a){var o=a,{components:e}=o,t=d(o,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(n(n({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("h2",null,"The Importance of \u2018Tear\u2019"),mdx("p",null,"There are two songs on \u201CTear\u201D that are called \u201CFake Love\u201D and \u201CTear.\u201D The connection between these two songs is not accidental: The tear is a sign of strength rather than weakness. As BTS lead vocalist Kim Nam-joon, known as RM, said in an interview with Billboard, \u201CThe difference between \u2018Fake Love\u2019 and \u2018Tear\u2019 is that in \u2018Fake Love\u2019, there was a lot of blame, there was a lot of \u2018you did this wrong\u2019, and \u2018you did this wrong\u2019. Whereas \u2018Tear\u2019 is really accepting the fact that it\u2019s all your fault, and you have to go through it.\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"Prologue: Remember Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`The first track on the EP \u2014 \u201CEuphoria\u201D \u2014 is a prelude to the rest of the album. It\u2019s a brief, one-minute and 33-second-long jumble of sounds that act as a reminder of who BTS are and what first connected them to their fans.
Dance breakers may enjoy this track the most because it\u2019s a full-on mix of mechanically programmed sounds and rhythmic beats that are somewhat reminiscent of the \u201890s.
It\u2019s like a trip down memory lane for fans who remember the band\u2019s roots. It\u2019s like BTS is saying \u201CRemember who we are? This is who we are.\u201D`),mdx("h2",null,"Tear and the Importance of Vocals in K-pop"),mdx("p",null,`The K-pop industry is primarily known for its dance routines and catchy hooks. \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D is a reminder to K-pop fans that vocals can be just as important as dance moves.
RM\u2019s vocals on \u201CFake Love\u201D are some of his strongest to date. He sings in both Korean and English throughout the track.
BTS\u2019s main vocalist, Kim Nam-joon, or RM, has always been the strong point of the group but on \u201CTear\u201D, he shines even brighter.
Namjoon sings with a certain amount of controlled emotion in both Korean and English on \u201CTear\u201D.`),mdx("h2",null,"The Darker Side of Love"),mdx("p",null,"The next two tracks \u2014 \u201CSuga\u201D and \u201CSeesaw\u201D \u2014 illustrate the darker side of love. They\u2019re the type of tracks that listeners might not pick up on their first few listens but will appreciate once they\u2019ve fully digested the EP. These tracks are less obvious than \u201CFake Love\u201D and \u201CTear\u201D. They aren\u2019t supposed to be obvious; they\u2019re supposed to be subtle and immersive."),mdx("p",null,`These two tracks are BTS\u2019s way of saying that love isn\u2019t all hearts and flowers. There are thorns and thistles that come from it, too.
These tracks prove that BTS isn\u2019t here for the sweet, saccharine love everyone talks about. They\u2019re here for the more realistic and often more complicated side of love.`),mdx("h2",null,"BTS\u2019s Vocals Are On Point in \u2018Tear\u2019"),mdx("p",null,`If there was ever a time to be a BTS fan and a K-pop listener, it\u2019s now. \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D is a reminder that BTS is an actual band with real instruments and not just a group of people who dance and sing in unison.
The drums, guitars, and pianos in these tracks are almost as important as the vocals. They aren\u2019t just pretty pieces of music; they have a purpose.
And BTS\u2019s use of instruments and vocals all come together to create a masterpiece.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"What makes BTS\u2019s \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D so special is that it proves the band isn\u2019t here to pander to their fans. They\u2019re not going to spit out songs about falling in love, being in love, and being heartbroken. They\u2019re here to make music that reflects their lives and how they feel about the world around them."),mdx("p",null,"BTS writes songs about the struggles that younger people face today. They write about growing pains, the pressures of university life, the difficulty of being in a relationship, and the difficulty of being alone. They write about the darker side of love \u2014 the side that isn\u2019t all hearts and flowers. END"),mdx("p",null,"In a world where every band is a boy band, BTS stands out. The Korean sextet has made a name for itself as not just another boy band but one that plays its own instruments and has choreographed dance routines that are so intricate they sometimes require special stage lighting."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Father John Misty's 'Pure Comedy' Is a Hilarious Masterpiece
Hip Hop Music with a Purpose: The Importance of Awareness in the Music Industry

intro.compiledSource:
var h=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var o=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var a=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var u=(e,s,t)=>s in e?h(e,s,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[s]=t,n=(e,s)=>{for(var t in s||(s={}))a.call(s,t)&&u(e,t,s[t]);if(o)for(var t of o(s))r.call(s,t)&&u(e,t,s[t]);return e},c=(e,s)=>d(e,m(s));var p=(e,s)=>{var t={};for(var i in e)a.call(e,i)&&s.indexOf(i)<0&&(t[i]=e[i]);if(e!=null&&o)for(var i of o(e))s.indexOf(i)<0&&r.call(e,i)&&(t[i]=e[i]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var i=t,{components:e}=i,s=p(i,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,c(n(n({},layoutProps),s),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`The music industry is vast, expansive, and unending. The number of subgenres and variations within the larger genres is innumerable. It\u2019s also an industry that has recently come under fire for its lack of diversity and representation in regards to gender, sexuality, religion, race, and so much more. As a result of these issues becoming more apparent and publicized, artists have been producing music with a purpose; focusing on important topics and causes through their music.
If you spend any time listening to rap or hip-hop music, you\u2019ve probably noticed how many songs are about money, sex, drugs, partying\u2014basically all the things you can do when you\u2019re rich and famous. But there are some rappers who are using their fame to make a difference in the world by speaking out about problems that need to be addressed: social injustice, poverty, drug abuse, child exploitation and other serious issues. These artists are making a conscious effort to use their music to make a positive impact on society rather than just focusing on things like materialism or promiscuity.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

A-Trak's 'in My Feelings' Is a Summer Bop You Need in Your Life
Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' Is a Solid Effort

He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Beach House's '7' Is a Dreamy Masterpiece
"The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var u=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var r=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var c=(e,t,n)=>t in e?m(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:n}):e[t]=n,o=(e,t)=>{for(var n in t||(t={}))s.call(t,n)&&c(e,n,t[n]);if(r)for(var n of r(t))i.call(t,n)&&c(e,n,t[n]);return e},h=(e,t)=>l(e,u(t));var d=(e,t)=>{var n={};for(var a in e)s.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(n[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&r)for(var a of r(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&i.call(e,a)&&(n[a]=e[a]);return n};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(n){var a=n,{components:e}=a,t=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(o(o({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Whiplash" Is a Tense and Exhilarating Look at the World of Jazz
Death Cab for Cutie's 'Thank You for Today' Is a Delight

intro.compiledSource:
var u=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var b=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var d=(e,t,o)=>t in e?u(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,r=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))i.call(t,o)&&d(e,o,t[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(t))s.call(t,o)&&d(e,o,t[o]);return e},h=(e,t)=>c(e,b(t));var l=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var a in e)i.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(o[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&s.call(e,a)&&(o[a]=e[a]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var a=o,{components:e}=a,t=l(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(r(r({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Thank You for Today is the sixth album from Seattle indie rockers Death Cab for Cutie. Released on August 31, 2018, it\u2019s also the band\u2019s final record with their original label Atlantic Records. After two decades in the music business, Death Cab for Cutie have developed into one of the most beloved bands in indie rock.
After their last album, Codes and Keys (2012), frontman Ben Gibbard announced that he was working on a solo project called The New Age. It was something he had been thinking about for some time but wasn\u2019t sure when or if it would come to fruition. Fortunately, after meeting with producer Rich Costey (M83, Blond Redhead) who helped him record some demos, things fell into place. The album came out as a collaborative release between Ben Gibbard and Nathan Wiley under the name The Further Adventures of New Age. And three years later Death Cab For Cutie released Thank You For Today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
